## IoT Inspector: Consent to Risks

IoT Inspector is an open-source tool that lets you inspect the network activities of your home network.

To analyze network activities, IoT Inspector uses a technique called [ARP Spoofing](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ARP_spoofing) on every single active device on your network

This technique will likely **slow down** your home network. In some cases, it may even **disrupt Internet connectivity** on your home network. For more information about these risks, please visit our [FAQ page](https://github.com/nyu-mlab/iot-inspector-client/wiki/Frequently-Asked-Questions#risks).

While IoT Inspector is running, avoid running latency-sensitive applications, such as video calls or games. Also avoid using critical IoT devices such as medical devices whose functionalities depend on Internet connectivity.

If your Internet connectivity is disrupted, quit IoT Inspector immediately. Your network should return to normal in about a minute. If the problem still persists, restart this computer (which runs IoT Inspector) and/or restart your home network.

If you have any questions, please email Prof. Danny Yuxing Huang at iot-inspector-study@nyu.edu. You may also report the problem at our [Issue Tracker](https://github.com/nyu-mlab/iot-inspector-client/issues).
